label: Description
value: Vertical panel of white satin embroidered in multicolored silks in a design of landscape scenes. At bottom is lotus and bamboo. Above is a pagoda over the water where a woman and child sit watching a boat with two passengers and a boatman. Above this, are small group of trees, rocks, birds, etc. At center is a group of two women with basket and staff. Above them is a fisherman. At top, fragments of landscape with a portion of a tree with feathery foliage, clouds and a flying bird.

label: Physical description
value: Medium: silk Technique: embroidered on satin weave

label: Credit line
value: Gift of Eleanor and Sarah Hewitt, from the textile collection of Mrs. Abram Stevens Hewitt

label: Description
value: Corporal has a center of red cut and uncut velvet in a large-scale symmetrical foliate design with a border of polychrome cut and uncut velvet on a white satin ground in a floral design. Trimmed with gold ribbon and backed with red wool.

label: Credit line
value: Gift of Eleanor and Sarah Hewitt, from the textile collection of Mrs. Abram Stevens Hewitt

label: Description
value: Burse has a center of red cut and uncut velvet on a red satin ground. Border of polychrome cut and uncut velvet on a white satin ground. Trimmed with gold ribbon and backed with linen.

label: Credit line
value: Gift of Eleanor and Sarah Hewitt, from the textile collection of Mrs. Abram Stevens Hewitt

label: Description
value: Stole of polychrome cut and uncut velvet on a white satin ground in a floral design. Ends trimmed with gold ribbon. Backed with linen.

value: Gift of Eleanor and Sarah Hewitt, from the textile collection of Mrs. Abram Stevens Hewitt

label: Description
value: Polychrome cut and uncut velvet on a white satin ground in a floral design. Ends trimmed with gold ribbon. Backed with linen.

value: Gift of Eleanor and Sarah Hewitt, from the textile collection of Mrs. Abram Stevens Hewitt

label: Description
value: Mezzaro in a multicolored design on a white ground. Central large-scale tree with many different blossoms. Small flanking tree on either side. Floral sprays, insects, birds and animals scattered over the ground. Double floral border.

label: Credit line
value: Gift of Eleanor and Sarah Hewitt, from the textile collection of Mrs. Abram Stevens Hewitt

label: Description
value: Border for a tablecloth in net darned with a pattern of angular scrolling vine with foliage and blossoms pointing alternately up and down. Two ends have double design placed back to back.

label: Physical description
value: Medium: linen Technique: needlework on knotted net

label: Credit line
value: Gift of Eleanor and Sarah Hewitt, from the textile collection of Mrs. Abram Stevens Hewitt

label: Description
value: Border fragment with diamond-shaped areas filled in with needle lace. Tiny openwork squares are grouped in between diamond-shaped areas. Pointed lace border.

label: Physical description
value: Medium: linen Technique: grid of withdrawn element work with needle lace, reticella style

label: Credit line
value: Gift of Eleanor and Sarah Hewitt, from the textile collection of Mrs. Abram Stevens Hewitt

value: Strip of insertion in a design of scrolling angular oak branches with foliage and acorns in reserve on the linen ground. Background of drawn work embroidered with red silk.

value: Medium: linen, silk Technique: embroidery, drawnwork

label: Credit line
value: Gift of Eleanor and Sarah Hewitt, from the textile collection of Mrs. Abram Stevens Hewitt

label: Description
value: Strip of reticella insertion and border, made separately and stitched together. Insertion design has zigzag lines setting off triangular areas which have rosettes.

value: Medium: linen Technique: grid of laid cords with needle lace, reticella style

value: Design of scrolling vine at lower border with some branches curving up to top edge. Leaves solid white blossoms have some openwork. Known as "Point Duchesse."

value: Medium: linen Technique: Brussels-style bobbin lace

value: Central floral spray design in varied stitches. Tiny two-leaved motifs powdered over ground.

label: Description
value: Central stem with one large rosette-like blossom, seven tiny rosette-like blossoms and five leaves. Eyelets powdered over ground. Drawstring in casing at lower edge.

label: Description
value: Pointed oval with floral group at either end with a curving stem of small and large rosette-like blossoms. Powdered eyelets over ground. Drawstring in casing at lower edge.

value: Gift of Eleanor and Sarah Hewitt, from the textile collection of Mrs. Abram Stevens Hewitt

label: Description
value:
Bottle green glass.  On one face, bust of Washington, with gueue, facing left. Inscription "THE FATHER OF HIS COUNTRY". Reverse, bust of Taylor, in uniform, facing left. Inscription: "GEN. TAYLOR NEVER SURRENDERS" "DYOTTVILLE GLASSWORKS PHILAD.A." with sheared mouth.

Housing recommended

label: Description
value: Case covered in white satin embroidered with flowers and fruit in colored silks, lined with pink silk, with pink ribbon and metal button fastner.

label: Physical description
value: Medium: silk and metal embroidery on silk foundation Technique: embroidered in chain, stem and running stitches on satin

label: Description
value: Landscape and water scenes with people and animals painted in color on an open weave foundation.

label: Physical description
value: Medium: silk Technique: painted on patterned (open) weave.

label: Description
value: Horizontal lozenge; outlined in blue and white reserve stripes, enclosing black field against which is a cyclix with grapes printed in grisaille.

label: Description
value: Valance with a white satin ground embroidered in multicolored silks. Double scalloped border in red with flowers and foliage motifs in the center of the scallops. Main ground has a landscape design with trees and rocks and small buildings on piles over water. Boat with a young couple and a boatman, and a man catching frogs. Fringe on two ends and backed with blue satin.

label: Physical description
value: Medium: silk Technique: embroidered on satin foundation

label: Description
value: White India muslin with all-over lozenge design brocaded in cotton. Embroidery in panel down the centre. Repeat of large bouquet of flowers tied with ribbon and butterfly carrying twig, worked in chain stitch with pink, blue, taupe, yellow, green, brown, and white silks. Two borders apparently sewed together at centre to form wide panel of embroidery. Joining backed with net.

label: Physical description
value: Medium: silk on cotton Technique: embroidery on brocaded India muslin

label: Description
value: Silk brocade fragment in burgundy and cream showing a serpentine line of c-curves with floral bouquets. Buds brocaded in silver.

label: Physical description
value: Medium: silk, metallic yarns Technique: complex woven with discontinuous supplementary weft patterning (brocade)

label: Provenance
value: Previous owner: Previously owned by Eleanor Garnier Hewitt, American, 1864–1924.

label: Description
value: Rectangular, with short cylindrical neck. Sides decorated with landscapes and figures, including seaport and skating scenes. Narrow gold border. On top, two dragonflies. Cover, with two harbor views, gold knob handle and broad gold band.

label: Physical description
value: hard paste porcelain, vitreous enamel, gold

label: Provenance
value: Eleanor Garnier Hewitt; 1931: acquired by Museum

label: Description
value: A white tea caddy with a bulbous shoulder and simple cup-like lid. Tea caddy outlined in gilt with painted birds, flowers and figure on the sides.

label: Physical description
value: hard paste porcelain, vitreous enamel, gold

label: Dimensions
value: H x diam. (a,b: overall): 10.5 × 9 cm (4 1/8 × 3 9/16 in.) H x diam. (a: caddy): 9.5 × 9 cm (3 3/4 × 3 9/16 in.) H x diam. (b: lid): 1.5 × 3.5 cm (9/16 × 1 3/8 in.)

label: Provenance
value: Eleanor Garnier Hewitt; 1931: acquired by Museum

label: Description
value: Vining floral design typical of Chinese hand painted wallpapers. In foreground, strange rock formation amid grassy plateaus, waterlillies in pond at right, two large predatory birds amidst smaller birds, hummingbird and butterflies. Painted in bright polychrome color.

label: Description
value: Vining floral design typical of Chinese handpainted wallpapers. Brightly colored birds and vines hand painted on silk.

label: Description
value: Miser's purse type, knitted in colored silks with ornamentation in bands showing conventionalized forms and spread eagles with crown and the words "S.D. Casparre Nicoletti." Partially lined in red silk.

label: Physical description
value: Medium: silk and metal-wrapped silk Technique: stranded knitting

label: Description
value: Background embroidered in red silk; animals, etc. ornamented with red dots. Top border reads "A Creation del Mundo --". At the left there is a narrow strip on white, the design is marked but not embroidered.

label: Physical description
value: Medium: silk on linen Technique: embroidered

label: Dimensions
value: H x W: 28 x 27 cm (11 in. x 10 5/8 in.)

label: Description
value: Design of flowers, birds, butterflies and scenes depicting men and animals.

value: Medium: silk Technique: satin weave with supplementary weft

label: Dimensions
value: Warp x Weft: 156.6 x 63 cm (5 ft. 1 5/8 in. x 24 13/16 in.)

label: Description
value: A custard pot with one handle; molded spirals on body. A lid, also with spirals, and a tall finial. Hand-painted enamel decoration showing green florals and swags, and an oval cartouche was a pink monochrome scene of a cherub.

label: Provenance
value: Sarah Cooper Hewitt and Eleanor Garnier Hewitt; 1931: acquired by Museum

value: Gift of Eleanor and Sarah Hewitt

label: Description
value: Narrow panel with borders on each side. Blue satin ground with a broad central band of floral vine entwined with serpentine ribbon. Symmetrical borders with stripes and flowers. Design in extra wefts of green, pink, and tan silk.
